Eligibility:
Eligibility

Only the professional degree courses BE/B Tech, Integrated 5-Yr Dual-Degree M Tech, MBBS and 5-Yr Integrated Law courses are eligible for scholarships. All other courses, including Diploma students admitted directly to their 2nd Year of BE/B Tech on a lateral basis, as well as, B Arch, BDS and BSc (Nursing) students, are not eligible.
Only those new, first-time students who are beginning their 1st year of study in the academic year 2024-25, are eligible. Applicants already in their 2nd year of study (or above) are not eligible.
The applicants should have passed their Class XII qualifying examination (Higher Secondary/Pre-university/Intermediate/CBSE/ISC or equivalent board) in 2022, 2023 or 2024. However, students who have passed their qualifying examination in 2024 will be preferred over those who have taken a break for preparation and better performance in their common entrance tests.
The applicants’ admissions to their professional degree courses should be on the basis of their open/general merit rank (and not category rank) at the state or national level entrance tests or through a counselling process conducted at the state level (as with Tamil Nadu) as per the following table.
The rank limits are based on the seat intake capacities of the various states as authorized by the All-India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) for Engineering/Technology (BE/ B Tech) and the Medical Council of India (MCI) for Medical (MBBS) degree.
The rank limit for the 5-Yr Integrated Law courses is based on the entrance examination as defined by the University.
Candidates with 40% or more disability pursuing Professional courses as mentioned above, will be considered for Scholarship
Benefits:
Benefits:
Every year the Foundation receives a large number of applications. Only those applicants who are eligible by the academic criteria & background verification will be awarded financial assistance. The final decision on the selection of deserving students rests with the Foundation.
All 1st year/ 1st time scholarship awardees of FY 2024-25 will receive a scholarship amount of INR 50,000.
Students who applied for their 1st Year of Scholarship in FY 2023-24 & renewing their scholarship in subsequent years will receive a Scholarship amount of INR 50,000. Renewal students prior to FY 2023-24 will receive INR 40,000, which can be utilized towards their education expenses.
Doc Required:
Documents Required

The student will be required to upload the following set of documents in their Eligible application immediately after filling their application form. Only the following Primary documents are mandatory for the verification call.
Primary Documents
1.Income certificate/Salary slip or Income tax return or bank statement of the parent.
2.Class twelfth (XII) grade cards issued by the SSC/ISC/CBSE board.
3.The Rank Certificate stating the rank scored by the student in the Entrance examination.
4.The counselling letter issued to the student during the seat allotment process.
5.Receipts for actual expenses already incurred for the academic year up to the date of submission of the application.
6.Applicant should upload his/her E-Aadhar in the application for KYC verification. The same will be deleted once the KYC verification is successful.
7.Differently abled students should submit their disability certificate issued by the State or district level certifying authority.
Secondary Documents
8.Applicants for scholarships must submit a “Bonafide Certificate” issued from the college authorities in the current academic year, establishing their status as a student for the specified course and year.
9.Applicants must provide a “Statement of Estimated Expenses or Fee Structure document” for the current academic year. The statement should be issued by the college authorities. Mere statements by students about their own estimated expenses are not acceptable.
10.Parent Declaration duly signed by parents which informs the parents about the scholarship received by their wards.
11.Student bank passbook copy indicating the Account number, IFSC code and other bank details. If the student is minor, then Joint account with any one parent will only be accepted.

Scholarship Name: PRADHAN MANTRI UCHCHATAR SHIKSHA PROTSAHAN (PM-USP) YOJANA 2023
Eligibility:
Eligibility for Scholarship
i. Students who are above 80th percentile of successful candidates in the relevant
stream from the respective Board of Examination in Class XII of 10+2 pattern or
equivalent;
ii. Pursuing regular degree courses and not correspondence or distance mode or
pursuing Diploma courses;
iii. Pursuing courses at colleges/institutions recognized by All India Council for
Technical Education and respective Regulatory Bodies concerned;
iv. Not availing benefit of any other scholarship schemes including State run
scholarship schemes/ fee waiver & reimbursement scheme;
v. Students with gross parental/family income upto Rs. 4.5 lakh per annum are
eligible for scholarship under the scheme. Income certificate will be required only
for the fresh applicants;
vi. Student changing his/ her college/institute of study will be allowed to
continue/renew the scholarship provided the course of study and the institution is
having valid AISHE Code; The AISHE code can be checked in the portal
https://aishe.gov.in/aishe/aisheCode
vii. Students who missed to apply for renewal of application online on NSP will be
allowed to apply for renewal of scholarship for subsequent year on NSP, if he/she
fulfils eligibility condition for renewal;
viii. For renewal of scholarship in each year of study, besides getting at least 50%
marks in the Annual Examination, maintenance of adequate attendance of at least
75%, will also be the criteria. Complaints against the student regarding any in
disciplined or criminal behaviour including any complaints of having indulged in
ragging, will lead to forfeiture of scholarship;
ix. Beneficiaries/ Applicants under the scheme must apply online in the National
Scholarships Portal (www.scholarships.gov.in) for the fresh/ renewal scholarships.
Fresh/Renewal applications sent directly to the Ministry of Education shall not be
accepted.
Benefits:
The rate of scholarship is Rs.12,000/-per annum at Graduation level for first three
years of College and University courses and Rs.20,000/-per annum at PostGraduation level. Students pursuing professional courses, in case, where the duration
of course is five (5) years/Integrated course will get Rs. 20,000/-per annum in the
4
th and 5th year. However, students pursuing technical courses such as B.Tech,
B.Engg. will get scholarship up to graduation level only i.e. Rs. 12,000 p.a. for 1st
,
2
nd and 3rd year and Rs. 20,000 in the 4th year.
Note: The rate of scholarship is Rs.10,000/-per annum for first three years of fresh/
renewal scholarships with respect to academic year 2021-22, even if the actual release
happens in FY 2022-23.

Eligibility
Candidates should be Indians, not older than 45 years as of June 30, 2024, and graduates of a recognised Indian university with at least 60% marks on average in their undergraduate or postgraduate studies. Candidates planning to pursue postgraduate and undergraduate studies in India are not eligible to apply.

Candidates who are planning to study for a diploma of at least one year duration, whose entry level requirement is higher secondary level, are not eligible to apply.

Scholarship Name: SBIF Asha Scholarship Program for Postgraduate Students
Eligibility:
Applicants must be pursuing a postgraduate course (any year) from a premier university/college in India, as listed in the Top 100 Institutes according to the latest NIRF rankings.

Students must have secured 75% marks or above in their previous academic year.
The gross annual family income of the applicants must be up to INR 6,00,000. 

Applicants should be Indian nationals.

Note: 

Premier institutions and renowned colleges will include those listed in the top 100 National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) List for Universities and the top 100 in the NIRF List for Colleges for 2023 and 2024 (released by the Ministry of Education, Government of India). Additionally, all National Institutes of Technology (NITs) will also be included.

Preference will be given to students with a family income of up to INR 3,00,000 per annum.

50% of the slots will be reserved for female applicants. 

Preference will be given to students belonging to the Scheduled Castes (SC) and Scheduled Tribes (ST) categories.
Benefits: Up to INR 70,000
Doc Required:
Marksheet from the previous academic year (Class 10/Class 12/Graduation/Postgraduation, as applicable)

Government-issued identity proof (Aadhaar card)

Current year fee receipt

Proof of current year admission (admission letter/institution identity card/bonafide certificate)

Bank account details of the applicant (or parent)

Proof of income (Form 16A/income certificate from a government authority/salary slips, etc.)

Photograph of the applicant

Caste Certificate (Wherever Applicable)
